data.title: A Total Variation Based Spiral Video Visualization Method
data.affiliation:
Wu, YD (Corresponding Author), Southwest Univ Sci \& Technol, Sch Comp Sci \& Technol, Mianyang, Peoples R China.
Wu, Yadong; Wang, Song; Lin, Shuiqiang; Han, Yongguo, Southwest Univ Sci \& Technol, Sch Comp Sci \& Technol, Mianyang, Peoples R China.
data.abstract: In order to clearly visualize the video structure and provide a user-friendly video content review and retrieve system, we firstly apply total variation (TV) metric to video shot segmentation and propose a novel video visualization method in this paper. Firstly, video data visualization design principles are proposed based on the analysis of video data characteristics. Secondly, a TV metric is proposed to measure the distance between two video frames. Then, video shots are detected by TV metric, and video key frames are extracted by K-means algorithm. Finally, according to the proposed video visualization design principles, a spiral video visualization method is proposed. Experimental results show that the proposed video visualization method can express the video content and the whole structure directly and clearly.
data.keywords: Video visualization; visualization principle; total variation; spiral structure; Video Visualization; Shot Segmentation
